titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Office Files of E. Walter Coward, Jr.
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Office Files of E. Walter Coward, Jr. FA514

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-01 01:25:05 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Office Files of E. Walter Coward, Jr.

physdesc.extent: 8 boxes (7 letter document containers and 1 half letter document containers)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary. In 2019, two boxes of material from Accessions 2019:140 (Box 41094) and 2019:106 (Box 41093) were added to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: One box of material was minimally processed in 2012. Two new boxes were added to this collection in 2019, and the whole collection was brought up to standard processing procedure by Katie Martin in December 2019.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains grant files, chronological correspondence files, reports, meeting notes, and conference materials of E. Walter Coward, Jr.

Dr. Coward served as a program officer, deputy director, and director of the Rural Poverty and Resources program at the Ford Foundation between 1989 and 1995. In 1996, he became the senior director of the Asset Building and Community Development program in the Office of the Vice President, as well as acting director of Human Development and Reproductive Health program.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: E. Walter Coward, Jr. served as a program officer, deputy director, and director of the Rural Poverty and Resources program at the Ford Foundation between 1989 and 1995. In 1996, he became the senior director of the Asset Building and Community Development program in the Office of the Vice President, as well as acting director of Human Development and Reproductive Health program. Before joining the Foundation, Dr. Coward was professor of Rural Sociology and Asian Studies at Cornell University. E. Walter Coward, Jr. retired from the Foundation in 1999. The Ford Foundation's Assets program was a worldwide program concerned with reproductive health, economic development and community and resource development.
